parts.text: Cows suffering from grass tetany are lacking in ...…….
Footbaths are used in the treatment of ...…….
Cows passing blood in their urine is an indicator of ...…….
Rapid breathing and coughing in calves is an indicator of ...…….
Lesions on the mouth, udder and nose of young lambs is ...…….
Organic matter content is very important in soil health.

subparts.text: Briefly describe two ways of increasing the organic matter content of soils.
Describe the functions of soil organic matter under the headings that follow.
Function Description Effect on soil pH

parts.text: Describe with the aid of a labelled diagram how a student could carry out an investigation to determine the percentage organic matter in a 100g sample of soil. Labelled diagram:
The results of the investigation are shown in the box below.

subparts.text: Calculate the % organic matter of the soil sample tested in part (b). Calculation:
Based on the results in part (i), state if the soil type is more likely to be a peat soil or brown earth soil.
All organic matter contains carbon. Calculate the % soil organic carbon in the soil sample using the equation shown in the box below. % Soil Organic Carbon = % Soil Organic Matter X 0.58

parts.text: (i) Sexed semen is when the X chromosome (female) and the Y chromosome (male) are separated in the sperm. Explain why this technology is an advantage on farms.
(ii) Outline one advantage of using straws from the Canadian bull that were 40 years old.
(iii) Briefly describe two advantages and two disadvantages of Artificial Insemination (AI) in cattle. Advantages Disadvantages 1. 1. 2. 2.

(i) Analyse the diagram and the questions that follow. Chemical (Pesticide) Biological Physical / Mechanical Cultural / Sanitation Prevention Using the list of words below, state to which category of pest management they belong.
